trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ServiceNow | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ServiceNow | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use ServiceNow with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use ServiceNow with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ServiceNow
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with ServiceNow

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ServiceNow.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ServiceNow.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A tenant in ServiceNow
trans-unit.target: A tenant in ServiceNow

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ServiceNow will be able to single sign into the application at your ServiceNow company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ServiceNow will be able to single sign into the application at your ServiceNow company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ServiceNow
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ServiceNow

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ServiceNow
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ServiceNow

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ServiceNow.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ServiceNow.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for ServiceNow, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for ServiceNow, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ServiceNow.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ServiceNow.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ServiceNow, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ServiceNow, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ServiceNow</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ServiceNow</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ServiceNow with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ServiceNow with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Dropbox for Business tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Dropbox for Business tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ServiceNow application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ServiceNow application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ServiceNow page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ServiceNow page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the ServiceNow Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://.servicenow.com*", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the ServiceNow Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://.servicenow.com*", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ServiceNow page, click Download certificate, save the certificate file locally on your computer, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ServiceNow page, click Download certificate, save the certificate file locally on your computer, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In your ServiceNow tenant, on the navigation bar at the left side, click Properties to open the SAML 2.0 Single Sign on properties page.
trans-unit.target: In your ServiceNow tenant, on the navigation bar at the left side, click Properties to open the SAML 2.0 Single Sign on properties page.

trans-unit.source: On the SAML 2.0 Single Sign-on properties page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML 2.0 Single Sign-on properties page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: As Enable external authentication, select Yes.
trans-unit.target: As Enable external authentication, select Yes.

trans-unit.source: In The Identity Provider URL which will issue the SAML2 security token with user info textbox, type **https://sts.windows.net//**.
trans-unit.target: In The Identity Provider URL which will issue the SAML2 security token with user info textbox, type **https://sts.windows.net//**.

trans-unit.source: In The base URL to the Identity Provider’s AuthnRequest service textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.
trans-unit.target: In The base URL to the Identity Provider’s AuthnRequest service textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.

trans-unit.source: In The base URL to the Identity Provider’s SingleLogoutRequest service textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.
trans-unit.target: In The base URL to the Identity Provider’s SingleLogoutRequest service textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.

trans-unit.source: In The protocol binding for the Identity Provider’s SingleLogoutRequest service textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect.
trans-unit.target: In The protocol binding for the Identity Provider’s SingleLogoutRequest service textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect.

trans-unit.source: As Sign LogoutRequest, select Yes.
trans-unit.target: As Sign LogoutRequest, select Yes.

trans-unit.source: In the When SAML 2.0 single sign-on fails because the session is not authenticated, or this is the first login, redirect to this URL textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.
trans-unit.target: In the When SAML 2.0 single sign-on fails because the session is not authenticated, or this is the first login, redirect to this URL textbox, type **https://login.windows.net//saml2**.

trans-unit.source: In the *Service Provider (Service-Now) properties *section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the *Service Provider (Service-Now) properties *section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In The URL to Service-now instance homepage textbox, type the URL to your ServiceNow instance homepage. The URL of the ServiceNow instance homepage is a concatenation of your ServiceNow tenant URL and /navpage.do: **https://.service-now.com/navpage.do** Service-now instance homepage
trans-unit.target: In The URL to Service-now instance homepage textbox, type the URL to your ServiceNow instance homepage. The URL of the ServiceNow instance homepage is a concatenation of your ServiceNow tenant URL and /navpage.do: **https://.service-now.com/navpage.do** Service-now instance homepage

trans-unit.source: In The entity identification, or the issuer textbox, type the URL of your tenant.
trans-unit.target: In The entity identification, or the issuer textbox, type the URL of your tenant.

trans-unit.source: In The audience uri that accepts SAML2 token textbox, type the URL of your tenant.
trans-unit.target: In The audience uri that accepts SAML2 token textbox, type the URL of your tenant.

trans-unit.source: In The User table field to match with the Subject’s NameID element in the SAMLResponse textbox, type email.
trans-unit.target: In The User table field to match with the Subject’s NameID element in the SAMLResponse textbox, type email.

trans-unit.source: In The NameID policy to use for returning the Subject’s NameID in the SAMLResponse textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified.
trans-unit.target: In The NameID policy to use for returning the Subject’s NameID in the SAMLResponse textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified.

trans-unit.source: 6 Leave Create an AuthnContextClass request in the AuthnRequest statement unchecked.
trans-unit.target: 6 Leave Create an AuthnContextClass request in the AuthnRequest statement unchecked.

trans-unit.source: 7 In The AuthnContextClassRef method that will be included in our SAML 2.0 AuthnRequest to the Identity Provider textbox, type http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/authenticationmethod/password.
trans-unit.target: 7 In The AuthnContextClassRef method that will be included in our SAML 2.0 AuthnRequest to the Identity Provider textbox, type http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/authenticationmethod/password.

trans-unit.source: In the Advanced settings section perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Advanced settings section perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In The number in seconds before “notBefore” constraint, or after “notOnOrAfter” constraint to consider still valid textbox, type 60.
trans-unit.target: In The number in seconds before “notBefore” constraint, or after “notOnOrAfter” constraint to consider still valid textbox, type 60.

trans-unit.source: To save the configuration, click Save.
trans-unit.target: To save the configuration, click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the navigation bar at the left side, click Certificate to open the Certificate page.
trans-unit.target: On the navigation bar at the left side, click Certificate to open the Certificate page.

trans-unit.source: To upload your certificate, on the certificate page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To upload your certificate, on the certificate page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Click New.
trans-unit.target: Click New.

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type SAML 2.0.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type SAML 2.0.

trans-unit.source: Select Active.
trans-unit.target: Select Active.

trans-unit.source: As Format, select PEM.
trans-unit.target: As Format, select PEM.

trans-unit.source: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In Notepad, open your Base-64 encoded file, and then copy the content of this file into the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: In Notepad, open your Base-64 encoded file, and then copy the content of this file into the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Paste the content of your clipboard into the PEM Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Paste the content of your clipboard into the PEM Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to ServiceNow.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to ServiceNow.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the ServiceNow application integration page, click Configure user provisioning. User provisioning
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the ServiceNow application integration page, click Configure user provisioning. User provisioning

trans-unit.source: On the Enter your ServiceNow credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:
trans-unit.target: On the Enter your ServiceNow credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:

trans-unit.source: Configure User Provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configure User Provisioning

trans-unit.source: In the ServiceNow Instance Name textbox, type the ServiceNow instance name.
trans-unit.target: In the ServiceNow Instance Name textbox, type the ServiceNow instance name.

trans-unit.source: In the ServiceNow Admin User Name textbox, type the name of the ServiceNow admin account.
trans-unit.target: In the ServiceNow Admin User Name textbox, type the name of the ServiceNow admin account.

trans-unit.source: In the ServiceNow Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.
trans-unit.target: In the ServiceNow Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.

trans-unit.source: Click validate to verify your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click validate to verify your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click the Next button to open the Next steps page.
trans-unit.target: Click the Next button to open the Next steps page.

trans-unit.source: If you want to provision all users to this application, select “Automatically provision all user accounts in the directory to this application”. Next Steps
trans-unit.target: If you want to provision all users to this application, select “Automatically provision all user accounts in the directory to this application”. Next Steps

trans-unit.source: On the Next steps page, click Complete to save your configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the Next steps page, click Complete to save your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to ServiceNow, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to ServiceNow, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ServiceNow **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ServiceNow **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Additional Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>List of Tutorials on How to Integrate SaaS Apps with Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory?</linkText><title></title></link>
